Key Arguments: The definition of 'harm' in the Bill is too broad and subjective, potentially limiting free expression.
Governments should not be exempt from the standards set by the Bill.
Big tech companies already filter content based on political views, and the Bill could enable more censorship.
Penalties based on global turnover are inappropriate; penalties should be based on the seriousness of the breach.
Notable Quotes: The definition of ‘harm’ is extremely broad, interpretative and subjective.
Big tech companies already filter content to suit their own political views.
I do not support the Bill in its current form as it will stifle free speech.
